Kevin,

Ahh yes, well put, that is the point I'm sure.  But it still seems a lot
easier to use a static (or singleton) for the objects you want to be shared
like that, and still have instance variables which are not shared (versus
instance variables for shared, ThreadLocal variables for not shared).

Anyway, it seems a little less mysterious now, anyway.  But I think I may
try to come up with a replacement for ActiveTestSuite that has this
described behavior instead.

Kevin

Kevin Bourrillion wrote:
> 
> And this does basically that.  But the problem is, all the threads are
> acting on the same actual TestCase instances.  Meaning that my test
case
> "firmament" becomes pretty much useless--an object I initialize in
setUp()
> might have been mucked with by another thread by the time I use it!

In my opinion, that might be the point. If all you want is one thread
per
object, then that doesn't test the thread safety of the object. To test
whether
an object is thread safe, you need to have multiple threads accessing
the same
object at the same time. 

Kevin Mukhar
